page.title: 01Nunnykirk
page.content: The area around Nunnykirk is a very rural area which is part of two large estates belonging to the Ord & Trevellyan families. Most of the land is used for grazing sheep or cattle but there are several small mixed woodland areas which are homes for deer, fox, squirrel, rabbits, pheasants etc. There is a local woodsman and gamekeeper and game shooting is a popular pastime. The river Font flows through the area from the reservoir further west. This is a sparsely populated area with most people working on local farms or at Nunnykirk Hall School which was, until nine years ago, the Ord family home. The local inhabitants have to travel to Morpeth (10 miles away) or Newcastle (30 miles away) for shopping or entertainment.
